It's good

I first played Portal some time back in high school- that would be well over a decade ago. I played it before the release of Portal 2 in 2011, and before I got a Steam account, merely playing it standalone, I can say that much, but the details beyond that are hazy as to when, exactly, I played it. I remember this much, at least: I loved it.

Near 15 years ago now, Valve made a game that still looks decent and feels good that wouldn't feel out of place being made today. Given, it's pretty well on the short side- old hand as I am, and having played through it before, it only took a little over two hours to complete the main story. I think my initial run was more in the 4-6 hour range, as I was so much more curious about all the background bits and hidden story trailed around the levels. There's a lot of it I just outright skipped this time around. I leapt straight past all the strange details, and my memories, vague as they are, solved a few puzzles for me along the way.

But I can certainly say this: I still enjoyed it. Every bit the brilliant puzzle platformer it was on release in 2007, Portal is a true legend of gaming and one of the highest-rated games on Steam with extremely good reason. Short, but intensely sweet, rich with details, rich with fascinating and- at the time- unique gameplay... Honestly, not much even today can adequately replicate the full range and function of the Portal Gun, a tool made truly legendary, which has been incorporated as a secret item in so many games it would take a week to list them. 

You may only get a less than ten hour experience out of this, even after sampling bonus maps, time trials, and more, but you're more likely to be absolutely delighted by every second of this game than almost any other on the market, even after all this time. I'd recommend this game to almost anyone with at least a little gaming skill, as some of the trickier jump chains can cause difficulty for the inexperienced.

Worht a buy when its on sale.  This game is not my genre  so i was happy its short and the puzzle elements pretty easy. Not i can't complete hard puzzles but i find it a waste of time. So i loved the pace, the Portal mechanics & humor. For 1‚Ç¨ i had a fun 5 houres and it didn't had to be more.

I spent 16 hours getting all of the achievements in this game, I played it multiple times for speedrunning purposes, and will probably continue to play it for years to come. Some may thing that the internet says it enough that this game is a masterpiece. But if you haven't played it, clearly you still haven't heard it enough times. This game is a masterpiece.

With the recent release of Aperture Desk Job, I felt like jumping back into the universe of Portal, and the more time I spend playing the games that are out, the more I fall in love with it. You have truly done yourself a disservice if you haven't played this game, and I hope one day that everyone gets to enjoy this fantastic piece of media.

The Portal series is one of the first big games I remember playing, so I may have a bit of nostalgia for it, but I think they are some of the greatest games around. The balance of not too difficult but not too easy puzzles is great. GLaDOS is a all time favorite character, It even has replay-ability. If you haven't already played Portal, you should. And then play Portal 2.

And then we wait for Valve to learn how to count to 3...

Over the many Valve titles ive played over my life time none have fully possessed my mind as much as Portal. The whole series is fantastic but what i'd give to play this game for the first time again. If you havent ever played it and dont know anything about the story or the mechanics this is one of those "must play" games you need to add to your list. Compared to Portal 2 or much of the half life games this one is incredibly short however it does include several bonus advanced maps and map challenges where you need to complete previous stages in the least amount of time, steps taken, or portals used which adds a good deal of extra playtime considering the challenges are especially difficult.

Portal 1 is about 15 years old and it is by far one of the best puzzle games ever made. This first game is short but has excellent puzzles. I do have to say that this game is not just a puzzle game but also a psychological horror with an interesting story. All in all, Portal 1 is a must try for anyone diving into the puzzle games or into valve games.

io ho giocato questo gioco senza audio, e decido alla fine, nell'ultima stanza, di ascoltare un po' la musica del gioco, perch√© graficamente non √® male, gameplay perfetto, ma non sapevo neanche se c'era un sottofondo musicale. Alzo il volume e capisco come mai sentivo mancasse qualcosa al gioco: la storia. Questa viene raccontata tramite dei dialoghi, che come idea ci pu√≤ stare, ma non erano sottotitolati. A parte ci√≤, consiglio questo gioco a tutti gli amanti dei giochi puzzle, e io sono comunque riuscito ad apprezzare il gioco senza conoscere la trama. Inoltre lo mettono quasi sempre in sconto insieme al suo successore che non vedo l'ora di provare.
